Key Match Events: Jazz Chisholm Jr.’s infield single in the 11th inning secured a thrilling 4-3 victory for the New York Yankees over the Kansas City Royals
Juan Soto’s go-ahead home run in the sixth extended the Yankees’ lead in the AL East to 1 1/2 games over Baltimore

Chisholm’s clutch hit came after Kris Bubic intentionally walked Aaron Judge, and with the infield playing in, Judge advanced to second on defensive indifference. Chisholm’s timely slap hit scored the winning run
The Royals’ successful challenge of a safe call at first base
Pre-Game Insights: The Orioles’ loss to Boston in extra innings allowed the Yankees to maintain their advantage
The Yankees’ victory solidified their position in the AL East
The Royals fell further behind Cleveland in the AL Central but maintained their hold on the second wild card spot
Miscellaneous Highlights: Due to Norton High School football coverage Friday, Royals Baseball coverage on SuperStar Country 102.5 & 1530 AM will resume on Saturday, with pregame starting at 11:30 AM and the first pitch at 12:05 PM
